location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘No.4. 5 ft.2 Barracouda or Sirmahi caught at KHOR KUWAI.’

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This black and white photograph shows a man, presumably Lieutenant-Colonel Charles Geoffrey Prior, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf and HM Consul-General, Bushire, with his left hand holding a rope looped around a plank above his head, attached to which is a five foot two inch Barracouda [Barracuda] or Sirmahi fish. The man is on board a ship, presumably L T Nearchus, and there is another man in the background to the left behind him.Inscriptions:Printed label on the reverse of the image: ‘No.4. 5 ft.2 Barracouda or Sirmahi caught at KHOR KUWAI.’
